page.title: 09BISHOPS CASTLE AUCTION.
page.content: Every Friday Bishops Castle has a {cattle and sheep}auction.All the local farmers bring live stock to be sold in the sale ring. The sale ring is in the corner of the auction yard. The auctioneer has a special stand and there are seats going up from the sale ring.There is also a bar where a lot of farmers go for a drink. The weighing area is next to the sale ring,it is like a sort of platform with a gate each side.The cattle are weighed and taken to their pens. Most of the farmers wear cloth caps and boiler suits with a coat on top. They are mostly wearing wellies but some are wearing boots.They go round the pens looking at the cattle and sheep deciding what to buy and discuss ing how their crops are growing.
